title: New Year's Eve Curried Shrimp Recipe
description: Guests at your New Year's Eve party will be clamoring for this Curried Shrimp recipe. Thank you for watching.

asset.author: Bed Bath & Beyond
asset.hookText:
http://blog.bedbathandbeyond.com/bbb-recipe/curried-shrimp-something-special-new-years-eve-party/
Guests at your New Year's Eve party will be clamoring for this Curried Shrimp recipe. Thank you for watching. Make sure you subscribe to the Bed Bath & Beyond YouTube channel.

transcripts:
Let's talk New Year's Eve. You have people over, you're making drinks, you're having fun with your guests. Do you really want to be standing in your kitchen cooking the whole time? 

If you're anything like me, you don't. So I say, you make something simple, so you're not in the kitchen the whole time. You make something delicious, so your guests are happy, and you make something still New Year's Eve worthy. 

My suggestion? Curried shrimp. And before you judge me on that, just watch this. 

[MUSIC PLAYING] 

In a medium pot, melt butter. Add flour, salt and pepper, paprika, and curry powder. Mix well, and it will be a thick, dry paste. Stir in milk, and let it thicken slowly. 

Then add bay shrimp. They're the small, already cooked little guys you buy from your fishmonger. And finally add ketchup and dry sherry. Stir well and heat through. 

And I like to have those little puff pastry shells with the removable top cooked and ready to go so your guests can simply make their own when they're hungry. And whether you keep the shrimp warm in a crock pot or a pot on the stove, it's all simple, delicious, and definitely New Year's Eve worthy. 

[MUSIC PLAYING]
